A Theory Like Any Other

A dimly lit room, tension rising.  
“Napoleon fascinates him. Genius without remorse?”  

“Do you deny him moral feeling?”  
“Ah, everything's muddled now, isn’t it?”  

---

A terrace under the stars, deep in thought.  
“Russians are broad in ideas, chaotic.”  

“Remember our talks? Was he planning then?”  
“Traditions are lost, made up from books.”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The discussion revolves around the idea that some individuals, believing themselves to be geniuses, justify wrongdoing by overstepping moral and legal boundaries, leading to a sense of humiliation when they fail to act boldly.
